cards.name: Nissa, Genesis Mage
cards.text:
+2: Untap up to two target creatures and up to two target lands.
−3: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
−10: Look at the top ten cards of your library. You may put any number of creature and/or land cards from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

rulings.text: You can activate Nissa's first ability with fewer than four targets. For example, you could target one creature and two lands, or no creatures and two lands. You could even choose no targets at all.

While resolving Nissa's last ability, all creatures and lands put onto the battlefield this way enter at the same time. If any have triggered abilities that trigger on something else entering the battlefield, they'll see each other.

cards.originalText:
+2: Untap up to two target creatures and up to two target lands.
−3: Target creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn.
−10: Look at the top ten cards of your library. You may put any number of creature and/or land cards from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Avid Reclaimer
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} or {U}. If you control a Nissa planeswalker, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "All can't be lost. Nissa has shown me that."

rulings.text: You can activate Avid Reclaimer's ability even if you don't have anything to spend that mana on. You'll still gain 2 life if you control a Nissa planeswalker.
Avid Reclaimer's ability is a mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to. You'll immediately add mana to your mana pool and gain 2 life, if applicable.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. If you control a Nissa planeswalker, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Brambleweft Behemoth
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: Life will find a way, or it will make one.
cards.originalText: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)

cards.name: Nissa's Encouragement
cards.text: Search your library and graveyard for a card named Forest, a card named Brambleweft Behemoth, and a card named Nissa, Genesis Mage. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can find any or all of the cards listed with Nissa's Encouragement. You could even find none, but that wouldn't be very encouraging.
Nissa's Encouragement can't be used to find a card with the land type Forest that isn't also named Forest (such as Sheltered Thicket from the Amonkhet set).

cards.originalText: Search your library and graveyard for a card named Forest, a card named Brambleweft Behemoth, and a card named Nissa, Genesis Mage. Reveal those cards, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Woodland Stream
cards.text:
Woodland Stream enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.
cards.flavor:
"Bolas's power on this plane can't be absolute. Look around you."
—Nissa Revane
cards.originalText:
Woodland Stream enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver
cards.text:
+3: Each opponent loses 3 life unless that player sacrifices a nonland permanent or discards a card.
−3: Destroy target creature. Draw a card.
−11: Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver deals 7 damage to each opponent. You draw seven cards.

rulings.text: While resolving Nicol Bolas's first ability, your opponent chooses a card to be discarded without revealing it, chooses a nonland permanent to be sacrificed, or chooses to do neither. Then that player discards that card, sacrifices that permanent, or loses 3 life. Your opponent can always choose to lose 3 life, even if they have cards to discard or nonland permanents to sacrifice.

In a multiplayer game, each opponent in turn order makes their choice for Nicol Bolas's first ability, then all of the actions occur simultaneously. Opponents will know choices made by earlier opponents when making their choices, although a card chosen to be discarded this way isn't revealed until it's discarded.

If the target of Nicol Bolas's second ability becomes illegal, the ability doesn't resolve and you won't draw a card. If that target is legal but can't be destroyed, most likely because it has indestructible, you still draw a card.
If Nicol Bolas's third ability causes each opponent to have 0 or less life, but it also causes you to try to draw more cards than you have in your library, the game ends in a draw.

foreignNames.name: 欺瞞の主、ニコル・ボーラス

cards.originalText:
+3: Each opponent loses 3 life unless that player sacrifices a nonland permanent or discards a card.
−3: Destroy target creature. Draw a card.
−11: Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver deals 7 damage to each opponent. You draw seven cards.

cards.name: Wasp of the Bitter End
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Bolas planeswalker spell, you may sacrifice Wasp of the Bitter End. If you do, destroy target creature.
cards.flavor: As the Second Sun glided into its final position in the sky, a chorus of wings sounded to herald the return of Nicol Bolas.

rulings.text: You choose a target for Wasp of the Bitter End's triggered ability right after casting a Bolas planeswalker spell, but you don't choose whether to sacrifice Wasp of the Bitter End or not until that ability resolves. If the creature becomes an illegal target, the entire ability doesn't resolve and you can't sacrifice Wasp of the Bitter End.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Bolas planeswalker spell, you may sacrifice Wasp of the Bitter End. If you do, destroy target creature.

cards.name: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh
cards.text: {4}{R}: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh deals 2 damage to target opponent or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: The God-Pharaoh's most devoted took it upon themselves to follow his example.
cards.originalText: {4}{R}: Zealot of the God-Pharaoh deals 2 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Visage of Bolas
cards.text:
When Visage of Bolas enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.
{T}: Add {U}, {B}, or {R}.
cards.originalText:
When Visage of Bolas enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Nicol Bolas, the Deceiver, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.
{T}: Add {U}, {B}, or {R} to your mana pool.

Cinder Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
cards.flavor:
"I do as I choose with what is mine. And it is all mine."
—Nicol Bolas
cards.originalText:
Cinder Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Apocalypse Chime
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Apocalypse Chime: Destroy all nontoken permanents with a name originally printed in the Homelands expansion. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"One day, or another, perhaps I shall ring my pretty chime . . . loudly, so that all may hear."
—Grandmother Sengir
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Sacrifice Apocalypse Chime to bury all cards from the Homelands expansion.

cards.name: Clockwork Gnomes
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
cards.flavor:
"Until I came to the Floating Isle, I never had to oil the servants."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact creature.

cards.name: Clockwork Steed
cards.text:
Clockwork Steed enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Steed can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
When Clockwork Steed's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

If Clockwork Steed has four or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up with a maximum of four such counters on it. If it has four or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.

cards.originalText:
Cannot be blocked by artifact creatures.
When Clockwork Steed comes into play, put four +1/+0 counters on it. At the end of any combat in which Clockwork Steed attacked or blocked, remove one of these counters.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Steed. You may have no more than four of these counters on Clockwork Steed. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Clockwork Swarm
cards.text:
Clockwork Swarm enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Swarm can't be blocked by Walls.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Swarm attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

cards.originalText:
Cannot be blocked by walls.
When Clockwork Swarm comes into play, put four +1/+0 counters on it. At the end of any combat in which Clockwork Swarm attacked or blocked, remove one of these counters.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm. You may have no more than four of these counters on Clockwork Swarm. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Didgeridoo
cards.text: {3}: You may put a Minotaur permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Play the song of he who delivered us. Play the song of Feroz."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText: {3}: Take a Minotaur from your hand and put it directly into play as though it were just summoned.

cards.name: Feroz's Ban
cards.text: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor:

—Daria

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Summon spells each cost an additional {2} to cast.

cards.name: Joven's Tools
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn except by Walls.
cards.flavor:
"If that thief Joven ever shows his head around here again, make sure he leaves without it."

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Target creature cannot be blocked except by walls until end of turn.

cards.name: Roterothopter
cards.text:
Flying
{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.flavor: "The Roterothopter is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in." —Baki, Wizard Attendant
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}: +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {4} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Serrated Arrows
cards.text:
Serrated Arrows enters the battlefield with three arrowhead counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no arrowhead counters on Serrated Arrows, sacrifice it.
{T}, Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

rulings.text: The upkeep trigger checks the number of counters at the start of upkeep, and only goes on the stack if there are no arrowhead counters at that time. It will check again on resolution, and will do nothing if you've somehow manage to get a new arrowhead counter on the Arrows.

cards.originalText:
When Serrated Arrows comes into play, put three arrowhead counters on it.
During your upkeep, bury Serrated Arrows if there are no arrowhead counters on it.
{T}: Remove an arrowhead counter from Serrated Arrows to put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Baron Sengir
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Baron Sengir this turn dies, put a +2/+2 counter on Baron Sengir.
{T}: Regenerate another target Vampire.
cards.flavor: "Beast. Defiler. The source of all my pain." —Ihsan's Shade

rulings.text: The Baron's ability will only regenerate creatures with type "Vampire," regardless of whether the creature has "Vampire" in its name.
Although Baron Sengir is now a Vampire, it still can't regenerate itself.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into the graveyard the same turn Baron Sengir damaged it, put a +2/+2 counter on Baron Sengir.
{T}: Regenerate target Vampire.

cards.name: Black Carriage
cards.text:
Trample
Black Carriage doesn't untap during your untap step.
Sacrifice a creature: Untap Black Carriage. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor:

—Chandler

rulings.text: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Does not untap during your untap phase.
{0}: Sacrifice a creature to untap Black Carriage. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Broken Visage
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact attacking creature. It can't be regenerated. Create a black Spirit creature token. Its power is equal to that creature's power and its toughness is equal to that creature's toughness. Sacrifice the token at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: The token creature enters the battlefield under your control regardless of who controlled the targeted creature.
The Spirit token has the power and toughness of the attacking creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Bury target non-artifact attacking creature and put a Shadow token into play.
Treat this token as a black creature with power and toughness equal to the power and toughness of that attacking creature. Bury Shadow token at end of turn.

cards.name: Drudge Spell
cards.text:
{B}, Exile two creature cards from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 black Skeleton creature token. It has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
When Drudge Spell leaves the battlefield, destroy all Skeleton tokens. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: This destroys all Skeleton tokens from all sources if it leaves the battlefield. It does not just destroy ones generated by this Drudge Spell or just ones you control.

The fact that Skeleton tokens are destroyed is an aspect of the enchantment and not of the tokens. Thus, only Skeleton tokens which are on the battlefield when it leaves the battlefield are destroyed. Ones which are going to appear due to use of the ability but which have not yet appeared are safe.
The creatures in the graveyard are exiled during activation as a cost.

cards.originalText: {B}: Remove from the game two target creatures in your graveyard to put a Skeleton token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 black creature with "{B} Regenerate". If Drudge Spell leaves play, bury all Skeleton tokens.

—Autumn Willow
cards.originalText: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and player.

cards.name: Dry Spell
cards.text: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:

cards.originalText: Dry Spell deals 1 damage to each creature and player.

cards.originalText: When target creature leaves play, that creature's controller sacrifices a creature he or she controls. Ignore this effect if that player controls no creatures.

Vigilance
Whenever Ghost Hounds blocks or becomes blocked by a white creature, Ghost Hounds gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Attacking does not cause Ghost Hounds to tap. 
If assigned to block any white creatures or any white creatures are assigned to block it, Ghost Hounds gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.originalText: At end of combat, put a -0/-2 counter on all creatures blocking or blocked by Greater Werewolf.

Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Ihsan's Shade
cards.text: Protection from white
cards.flavor:

—Baris, Serra Inquisitor
cards.originalText: Protection from white

cards.name: Irini Sengir
cards.text: Green enchantment spells and white enchantment spells cost {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"That cruel being brings shame to all her fellow Dwarves and misery to all the land. She is Sengir's daughter in spirit if not in blood."
—Reveka, Wizard Savant
cards.originalText: White enchantments and green enchantments each cost an additional {2} to cast.

cards.name: Koskun Falls
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Koskun Falls unless you tap an untapped creature you control.
Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.

rulings.text: In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, tap target untapped creature you control or bury Koskun Falls.
No creature can attack you unless its controller pays an additional {2} whenever that creature attacks.

cards.name: Sengir Autocrat
cards.text:
When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, create three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens.
When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.
cards.flavor:
"A thankless job, and a death sentence besides."
—Eron the Relentless

rulings.text: Sengir Autocrat's last ability exiles all Serf tokens, not just the Serf tokens its first ability created.

If Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield while its first ability is on the stack, its second ability triggers and exiles any Serf tokens that happen to be on the battlefield, and then its first ability resolves and gives you three Serf tokens.

cards.originalText: When Sengir Autocrat comes into play, put three Serf tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 0/1 black creatures. If Sengir Autocrat leaves play, bury all Serf tokens.

cards.name: Sengir Bats
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Bats this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.
cards.flavor:
"In the face of every one I see the Baron."
—Daria
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into the graveyard the same turn Sengir Bats damaged it, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.

cards.name: Sengir Bats
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Bats this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.
cards.flavor:
"They are the eyes of the Baron, and they know your fears."
—Ihsan's Shade
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature is put into the graveyard the same turn Sengir Bats damaged it, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Bats.

cards.name: Timmerian Fiends
cards.text:
Remove Timmerian Fiends from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{B}{B}{B}, Sacrifice Timmerian Fiends: The owner of target artifact may ante the top card of their library. If that player doesn't, exchange ownership of that artifact and Timmerian Fiends. Put the artifact card into your graveyard and Timmerian Fiends from anywhere into that player's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent.

rulings.text: Both this card and the target must be on the battlefield when announcing the ability. The target must be on the battlefield when the ability resolves or nothing happens.

cards.originalText:
Remove Timmerian Fiends from your deck before playing if not playing for ante.
{B}{B}{B}: Sacrifice Timmerian Fiends to bury target artifact that any opponent owns in your graveyard. Put Timmerian Fiends into that opponent's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent. The opponent may ante an additional card to counter this effect.

cards.name: Torture
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Oh, they scream, right enough, and plead, too—but the Baron keeps no mercy in his vault of horrors."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters that are put on the enchanted creature are independent of Torture. If Torture leaves the battlefield or is moved to another creature, the counters will stay put.

cards.originalText:
Choose target creature.
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on creature Torture enchants.

cards.name: Torture
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"It helps you pass the time until you die."
—Grandmother Sengir

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters that are put on the enchanted creature are independent of Torture. If Torture leaves the battlefield or is moved to another creature, the counters will stay put.

cards.originalText:
Choose target creature.
{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on creature Torture enchants.

cards.name: Veldrane of Sengir
cards.text: {1}{B}{B}: Veldrane of Sengir gets -3/-0 and gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"Poor, foolish Veldrane. He goes wherever the Baron wills him. One day, he'll go to die."
—Halina, Dwarven Trader
cards.originalText: {1}{B}{B}: Forestwalk and -3/-0 until end of turn

cards.name: Aether Storm
cards.text:
Creature spells can't be cast.
Pay 4 life: Destroy Aether Storm. It can't be regenerated. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.flavor:
"I do love the rain . . . but this storm feels somehow wrong, Taysir."
—Daria

rulings.text: This does not stop a creature card from being put directly onto the battlefield by a spell or ability.
Affects any spell with the type creature, including those with other types such as artifact or enchantment. This includes older cards with "summon" on their type line.

cards.originalText: No summon spells may be cast. Any player may pay 4 life to bury Æther Storm. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Baki's Curse
cards.text: Baki's Curse deals 2 damage to each creature for each Aura attached to that creature.
cards.flavor:
"Those who fling spells too quickly should have reason to regret it."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant
cards.originalText: Baki's Curse deals 2 damage to each creature for each creature enchantment on that creature.

cards.name: Chain Stasis
cards.text: You may tap or untap target creature. Then that creature's controller may pay {2}{U}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.
cards.flavor:
"Here we go again."
—Kakra, Sea Troll

rulings.text: The decision to tap or untap is made on resolution of the spell (and of each copy).
Paying to make Chain Stasis continue is done as part of the resolution of the spell.
The copy is a spell, so it can be targeted by other spells and abilities that target a spell.
The player putting the copy spell on the stack controls that spell.
The spell copy has all the text and can result in itself being copied.

cards.originalText: Tap or untap target creature. Whenever any player uses Chain Stasis to tap or untap a creature, that creature's controller may pay {2}{U} to use Chain Stasis to tap or untap any target creature.

cards.name: Coral Reef
cards.text:
Coral Reef enters the battlefield with four polyp counters on it.
Sacrifice an Island: Put two polyp counters on Coral Reef.
{U}, Tap an untapped blue creature you control, Remove a polyp counter from Coral Reef: Put a +0/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
When Coral Reef comes into play, put four polyp counters on it.
{0}: Sacrifice an island to put two polyp counters on Coral Reef.
{U}: Tap target blue creature you control and remove a polyp counter from Coral Reef to put a +0/+1 counter on any target creature.

cards.name: Dark Maze
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"Stray not into the path of darkness, or be lost forever."
—Baki, Wizard Attendant
cards.originalText: {0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn. At end of turn, remove Dark Maze from the game. Dark Maze cannot attack the turn it comes under your control.

cards.name: Dark Maze
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"The path of faith is fortunately fraught with failure."
—Irini Sengir
cards.originalText: {0}: Dark Maze can attack this turn. At end of turn, remove Dark Maze from the game. Dark Maze cannot attack the turn it comes under your control.

cards.name: Forget
cards.text: Target player discards two cards, then draws as many cards as they discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Target player chooses and discards 2 cards from his or her hand. If that player does not have enough cards in hand, his or her entire hand is discarded. The player then draws as many cards as he or she discarded in this way.

cards.name: Giant Albatross
cards.text:
Flying
When Giant Albatross dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, for each creature that dealt damage to Giant Albatross this turn, destroy that creature unless its controller pays 2 life. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: The ability works no matter how it goes to the graveyard from the battlefield. It seeks out all creatures that damaged it during the turn and causes them to be destroyed.
The ability works even if the damage is redirected to the Albatross.
The ability is a triggered ability and is only put on the stack once just after this card goes to the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}: Bury all creatures that damaged Giant Albatross this turn. The controller of any of those creatures may pay 2 life to prevent that creature from being buried. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life. Use this ability only when Giant Albatross is put into the graveyard from play.

cards.name: Giant Albatross
cards.text:
Flying
When Giant Albatross dies, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, for each creature that dealt damage to Giant Albatross this turn, destroy that creature unless its controller pays 2 life. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: The ability works no matter how it goes to the graveyard from the battlefield. It seeks out all creatures that damaged it during the turn and causes them to be destroyed.
The ability works even if the damage is redirected to the Albatross.
The ability is a triggered ability and is only put on the stack once just after this card goes to the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}: Bury all creatures that damaged Giant Albatross this turn. The controller of any of those creatures may pay 2 life to prevent that creature from being buried. Effects that prevent or redirect damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life. Use this ability only when Giant Albatross is put into the graveyard from play.

cards.name: Giant Oyster
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Giant Oyster during your untap step.
{T}: For as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, target tapped creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step, and at the beginning of each of your draw steps, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. When Giant Oyster leaves the battlefield or becomes untapped, remove all -1/-1 counters from the creature.

rulings.text: If the Oyster untaps during the draw step before its ability to add a -1/-1 counter resolves, the -1/-1 counter effect resolves and adds a -1/-1 counter after the -1/-1 counters are removed due to being untapped.
The activated ability can target only a tapped creature.

Activating the ability creates a continuous effect that works only as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, a repeating delayed triggered ability that's in effect only as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped, and a delayed triggered ability that triggers when Giant Oyster untaps or when it leaves the battlefield.
Giant Oyster's ability can be activated during your upkeep, and the creature will get a -1/-1 counter during the draw step that follows it.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Giant Oyster during your untap phase.
{T}: Target tapped creature does not untap during its controller's untap phase as long as Giant Oyster remains tapped. During your upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature. If Giant Oyster becomes untapped or leaves play, remove all these counters from the creature.

cards.name: Jinx
cards.text:
Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"What wizards upset, the land soon rights."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess
cards.originalText: Target land becomes a basic land type of your choice until end of turn. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Labyrinth Minotaur
cards.text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"Legend says they got a treasure cave, but it don't say where to find it."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate

rulings.text: If the creature Labyrinth Minotaur blocked is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.

Labyrinth Minotaur doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: Creatures Labyrinth Minotaur is assigned to block do not untap during their controller's next untap phase.

cards.name: Labyrinth Minotaur
cards.text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I doubt any Labyrinth Minotaurs still live—but then again, we Minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman

rulings.text: If the creature Labyrinth Minotaur blocked is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.

Labyrinth Minotaur doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: Creatures Labyrinth Minotaur is assigned to block do not untap during their controller's next untap phase.

cards.name: Marjhan
cards.text:
Marjhan doesn't untap during your untap step.
{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Untap Marjhan. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Marjhan can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{U}{U}: Marjhan gets -1/-0 until end of turn and deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Marjhan.

rulings.text: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Does not untap during your untap phase.
Marjhan cannot attack if defending player controls no islands. If at any time you control no islands, bury Marjhan.
{U}{U}: Sacrifice a creature to untap Marjhan. Use this ability only during your upkeep.
{U}{U}: -1/-0 until end of turn. Marjhan deals 1 damage to target attacking creature without flying.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Um . . . oh . . . what was I saying?"
—Reveka, Wizard Savant

rulings.text: Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell's destination from its owner's library to exile.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Put that spell on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

rulings.text: Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell's destination from its owner's library to exile.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Put that spell on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Merchant Scroll
cards.text: Search your library for a blue instant card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"There's no trade without trust."
—Eron, the Relentless

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a blue instant or interrupt. Reveal that card to all players and put it into your hand. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Mystic Decree
cards.text: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.
cards.flavor:
"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir

rulings.text: This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.

cards.name: Narwhal
cards.text: First strike, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"Who needs a spear? Ya break off the horn, and ya stab the fish with it. Easy!"
—Kakra, Sea Troll
cards.originalText: First strike, protection from red

cards.name: Reef Pirates
cards.text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Zeki sails with a dead crew not out of villainy, but pragmatism."
—Baron Sengir
cards.originalText: Whenever Reef Pirates damages any opponent, take the top card of his or her library and put it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Reef Pirates
cards.text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Corpses for crew don't sit well with me. Zeki and his dead ship had best keep their distance."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable
cards.originalText: Whenever Reef Pirates damages any opponent, take the top card of his or her library and put it into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Reveka, Wizard Savant
cards.text: {T}: Reveka, Wizard Savant deals 2 damage to any target and doesn't untap during your next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"It's nice to see a sister Dwarf in a position of such power, but why'd it have to be one of those seafaring muleheads?"
—Halina, Dwarven Trader

rulings.text: Reveka's effect causes it not to untap during _your_ next untap step. If another player gains control of it, it will untap during that player's next untap step.

cards.originalText: {T}: Reveka deals 2 damage to target creature or player and does not untap during your next untap phase.

cards.name: Sea Sprite
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"No one can catch what won't be caught."
—Kakra, Sea Troll
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Sea Troll
cards.text: {U}: Regenerate Sea Troll. Activate this ability only if Sea Troll blocked or was blocked by a blue creature this turn.
cards.flavor:
"I've seen those Trolls devour a drowning sailor faster than his lungs could fill with water."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate
cards.originalText: {U}: Regenerate. Use this ability only during a turn in which Sea Troll blocked a blue creature or a blue creature blocked Sea Troll.

cards.name: Wall of Kelp
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}{U}, {T}: Create a 0/1 blue Plant Wall creature token with defender named Kelp.
cards.flavor:
"Ya can eat it or ya can weave it, but ya can't fight in it."
—Zeki, Reef Pirate
cards.originalText: {U}{U}, {T}: Put a Kelp token into play. Treat this token as a 0/1 blue wall.

cards.name: An-Havva Constable
cards.text: An-Havva Constable's toughness is equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Joskun and the other Constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, Faerie Noble
cards.originalText: An-Havva Constable has toughness equal to 1 plus the total number of green creatures in play.

cards.name: An-Havva Inn
cards.text: You gain X plus 1 life, where X is the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"The Inn was ever a steady source of good cheer and kindness. Greatly do I miss it, now that I am gone."
—Ihsan's Shade
cards.originalText: Gain 1+* life, where * is equal to the total number of green creatures in play.

cards.name: Autumn Willow
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
{G}: Until end of turn, Autumn Willow can be the target of spells and abilities controlled by target player as though it didn't have shroud.
cards.flavor:
"We must shake her limbs and rattle her brains."
—Grandmother Sengir

rulings.text: This spell can be countered. Shroud does not work until it enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Cannot be the target of spells or effects.
{G}: Target player may target Autumn Willow with spells or effects until end of turn.

cards.name: Carapace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"The tougher to crack, the sweeter the snack."
—Kakra, Sea Troll

rulings.text: This leaves the battlefield when you activate its activated ability, but the enchanted creature won't be regenerated until the ability resolves. In the intervening time, the creature will no longer have the bonus that this had been giving it. This may cause the creature to be destroyed before the regeneration shield is created.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +0/+2.
{0}: Sacrifice Carapace to regenerate creature Carapace enchants.

cards.name: Carapace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Now, that's a fashion statement."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

rulings.text: This leaves the battlefield when you activate its activated ability, but the enchanted creature won't be regenerated until the ability resolves. In the intervening time, the creature will no longer have the bonus that this had been giving it. This may cause the creature to be destroyed before the regeneration shield is created.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +0/+2.
{0}: Sacrifice Carapace to regenerate creature Carapace enchants.

cards.name: Daughter of Autumn
cards.text: {W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target white creature this turn is dealt to Daughter of Autumn instead.
cards.flavor:
"Those who say that Serra is dead have never met the Autumn Willow's daughters. They are as kind and as generous as Serra would wish us to be."
—Gulsen, Abbey Matron
cards.originalText: {W}: Redirect to Daughter of Autumn 1 damage dealt to a white creature.

cards.name: Faerie Noble
cards.text:
Flying
Other Faerie creatures you control get +0/+1.
{T}: Other Faerie creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Faeries talk all in riddles and tricky bits, 'cept the Nobles. Now, there's some straight talkers."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable
cards.originalText:
Flying
All Faeries you control get +0/+1.
{T}: All Faeries you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Folk of An-Havva
cards.text: Whenever Folk of An-Havva blocks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"There are those who accept being told what to do, what to think, and what to say. Then there are the Folk of An-Havva."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist
cards.originalText: If assigned as a blocker, Folk of An-Havva gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Folk of An-Havva
cards.text: Whenever Folk of An-Havva blocks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"This town's only for good folk. The rest can go to the city."
—Joskun, An-Havva Constable
cards.originalText: If assigned as a blocker, Folk of An-Havva gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hungry Mist
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, pay {G}{G} or bury Hungry Mist.

cards.name: Hungry Mist
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"If the air must feed, let it take the self-righteous."
—Murat, Death Speaker
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, pay {G}{G} or bury Hungry Mist.

cards.name: Joven's Ferrets
cards.text:
Whenever Joven's Ferrets attacks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
At end of combat, tap all creatures that blocked Joven's Ferrets this turn. They don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

rulings.text: The second ability will trigger only if Joven's Ferrets is still on the battlefield at end of combat. If it's been dealt lethal combat damage and destroyed during that combat (or has left the battlefield during that combat by any other means), its ability won't trigger and the creatures that blocked it won't be affected.

If a creature affected by the second ability is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.

The second ability doesn't track the creatures' controllers. If an affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Joven's Ferrets will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: If declared as an attacker, Joven's Ferrets gets +0/+2 until end of turn. At end of combat, tap any creatures that blocked Joven's Ferrets. Those creatures do not untap during their controller's next untap phase.

cards.name: Leaping Lizard
cards.text: {1}{G}: Leaping Lizard gets -0/-1 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I never question the Autumn Willow about her motives, not even when she turns people into Lizards. It's her way."
—Devin, Faerie Noble
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Flying and -0/-1 until end of turn

cards.name: Mammoth Harness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses flying.
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, the other creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature loses flying. If any creature is assigned to block the creature Mammoth Harness enchants or has the creature Mammoth Harness enchants assigned to block it, that creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Primal Order
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands they control.
cards.flavor:
"It's strange, but I can feel it when the land is corrupted. I understand why the Autumn Willow is so protective."
—Daria
cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals 1 damage to that player for each non-basic land he or she controls.

cards.name: Renewal
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land to search your library for a basic land and put it directly into play. This does not count towards your one land per turn limit. Reshuffle your library afterwards. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Root Spider
cards.text: Whenever Root Spider blocks, it gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They're not half as fierce if they don't see you coming."
—Devin, Faerie Noble
cards.originalText: If assigned as a blocker, Root Spider gains first strike and gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Roots
cards.text:
Enchant creature without flying
When Roots enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.flavor:
"That which nourishes can also bind."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess
cards.originalText: Tap target creature without flying. That creature does not untap during its controller's untap phase.

cards.name: Rysorian Badger
cards.text: Whenever Rysorian Badger attacks and isn't blocked, you may exile up to two target creature cards from defending player's graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life for each card exiled this way and Rysorian Badger assigns no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Rysorian Badger attacks and is not blocked, you may choose to have it deal no damage to defending player this turn. If you do so, remove from the game up to two target creatures from that player's graveyard. Gain 1 life for each creature removed in this way.

cards.name: Shrink
cards.text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The smallest beast can yet have the greatest heart."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shrink
cards.text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba Shaman
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
